before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bjpe","text":"Two experienced observers (1 Dipl. ECVS and 1 ECVS resident, with more than 3 years in TPA measurement) assessed the radiographs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69ool","text":"Radiographs were anonymized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdqi5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"371pa","text":"This radiographic evaluation protocol was used perioperatively to manage dogs treated by TPLO for cranial cruciate ligament disease.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs5g2","text":"Tibial Plateau Angle was measured following previously described landmarks (Dismukes 2008).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i8su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9raed","text":"Mechanical axis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dpev","text":"The landmarks used to determine the mechanical axis were the midpoint between the apices of the 2 tibial intercondylar eminences and the center of the circle created by the talus for proximal and distal tibia, respectively. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64dfp","text":"Joint surface landmarks:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8be8a","text":"- landmarks established for the proximal tibial joint orientation line were the cranial and caudal aspects of the medial tibial condyle,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpgb0","text":"- landmarks established for the distal tibial joint orientation line were the distal aspect of the distal intermediate ridge of the tibia, cranially, and the caudodistal aspect of the cochlea tibia, caudally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqomu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm9bt","text":"Bone healing was subjectively graded using a previously developed scale (Oxley 2012), modified to allow numerical grading:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e27l7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcrsr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9vi3","text":" Score Healing grade Description 0 None No biological activity 1 Poor Some evidence of bone healing but unbridged cortices and/or osteotomy gap 2 Good Active bridging callus and/or osteotomy mostly blurred or filled with callus 3 Complete Remodeled callus at all cortices and/or osteotomy indistinct ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":342}],"data":{}},{"key":"4dqmt","text":" callus and/or osteotomy mostly blurred or filled with callus "],["3 ","Complete ","Remodeled callus at all cortices and/or osteotomy indistinct "]],"guid":"34DD1590E7CE11EC84C70A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Score ","Healing grade ","Description "],["0 ","None ","No biological activity "],["1 {"blocks":[{"key":"c1mjv","text":"Owners of dogs presenting insufficient bone healing (grades 0 and 1) at follow-up were asked for a recheck after 4 to 6 weeks to ensure sufficient bone healing (grades 2 or 3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Radiographic evaluation
